main event: A meteor allegedly struck the car of a 17-year-old boy named Rick Barnes in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma in 1964.
interesting points: The meteor struck the rear of Barnes' car, causing extensive damage to the right rear fender and rear quarter panel.
Barnes found several small fragments of the alleged meteorite in the area near the impact point.
Analysis by a local meteorologist determined the fragments to be a nickel-iron meteorite, which is a very rare type.
Other witnesses reported seeing a mysterious glow in the sky and a flamelike object around the time of the incident.
Air Force experts who examined the fragments were unable to definitively identify what the object was or where it came from.
sighted object: a large, silver, disc-shaped craft that resembled a 'pancake saucer'
photographs: yes, the report includes photographs of the recovered meteorite fragments
